caption: Great place to have a drink , great music and a wonderful food menu
The duck burger was delicious, service was great. Can't wait to go back and try everything else on the menu!

From the drinks to the food, everything was incredible. Friendly atmosphere that makes you feel at home. Really like that this restaurant is owned by two veterans, who work there daily. Their passion for building community through sharing food shines through.
Great food and fantastic atmosphere!
Great drinks....

Went here for the first time tonight and was absolutely blown away by the food. The chefs took such care in making every flavor come together, presentation, quality of food, portion. I cannot say enough about this place and already looking forward to coming back to try the other menu items!!
Yakitori will blow your socks off, my favorite sandwich is the suckling pig banh mi, the new blueberry souffle is AMAZING!

Foc’sle has been taken to new levels in Gainesville. Every plate that I had was freshly prepared and tasted fantastic. The roasted tomato salad literally melted in my mouth. Each visit I will be having a new dish. Service was top notch, always there at the right time but not hovering. Social distancing accommodations were great, with ample table spacing. Located in an area that at night can get a little “busy”, but definitely not a reason to miss this gem.

Owned & operated by Navy veterans, Foc’sle has become one of my hometown’s favorite spots. Their ingredients are fresh & every single item is house made... down to every sauce. One of my favorite dishes is their Korean sweet potato tacos on blue corn tortillas. The house made tomatillo salsa is amazing!! Every single one of their soups have been mouth watering. They have food for meat eaters & vegetarians/ vegans. Definitely check them out.
While usually open to new experiences I just found this restaurant to be completely underwhelming and too much left to be desired for the price of the dinner. Service was subpar, but very friendly.

The food is delicious! Eclectic menu and educated vocabulary makes this a must go!  The staff is attentive and can explain the adventurous meals. Thank you for the relaxing ambiance and fabulous craft cocktails. To top it off, let’s all support our veterans.

tl;dr the food wasn't good enough to justify the subpar service & the service wasn't good enough to justify the subpar food.  I was excited to bring friends of mine to come eat here after visiting a few times before. I was sort of on the fence about this restaurant, but my friends were really excited to go. When we entered, one of the wait staff greeted us Moe's style by bellowing across the almost empty restaurant. The staff was behind the front counter & our party was standing near the front door; the only other couple dining there looked up from their meal, obviously disturbed by the shouting. We were sat & very excited to try out some menu items that we weren't able to eat before due to their unavailability on previous visits. We sat down & excitedly chose from the menu. Upon ordering, our server let us know that Foc'sle had none of the items on the 'Mains' section of the menu available. She gave us time to rethink our orders. One member of our party sat without water for several visits from the server & finally had to ask for more in the now empty dining room. Each couple in our party ordered the duck confit tots; one order was brought out as an appetizer, the other was brought out as a main. The garlic aioli on the tots was so lovely that one couple ordered a little more, upon delivery of the second order of tots, the server informed us that the restaurant had also run out of the aioli but she thought ketchup would be an ok substitute instead. The server wore her mask, mostly. However, while refilling the waters, she was maskless and speaking to us right over the open water pitcher. Our table agreed that the Yakitori seemed to be charred and scantily seasoned with very little to no sauce, the tots were okay, but we would've loved both orders with the correct sauce, and the tacos weren't what one member of our party was expecting. The corn tortilla wasn't what one would envision based on the menu description, and they fell apart immediately when attempting to pick them up. I ordered a drink I'd had before and it tasted and looked different than the last time, just as the wings did; although inconsistent, both were pretty palatable. We were a little disappointed generally, and forewent the dessert we were originally planning to get because one member of our party hadn't eaten much and he was left still wanting dinner. Everyone has off nights, and an isolated incident is absolutely understandable; however, just about everything about our visit was a swing and a miss. If I was the owner, I'd want to know if my clients had an experience such as this one. Unfortunately, everything seemed to fall flat.  We came in with high hopes, wanting to have a pleasant dining experience, however, besides the ambiance & lovely decoration, everything else was pretty disappointing.
Fantastic service and a creative menu

I ate here for the first time today. I am vegan, and the chef was extremely accomodating for me. I had the tacos(sweet potato), the beet burger, butternut squash soup, the roasted tomato salad, and the grilled avocado. Everything was delicious! There are thoughtful touches on each dish with beautiful presentation. The service was attentive and educated, and the ambiance of the restaurant is classy and elegant. It's nice to have restaurant like this in Gainesville. I highly recommend it!
Food, drinks, staff & owners... just a great place to drink and eat amazing foods!!

Had a wonderful time! Food and drinks are great. Phillip and Glenn make you feel like family. We ordered the croque madam and the lamb tacos. So delicious. Make sure to order the crispy tots and crack pie! Will definitely be back.

Simply Amazing. Was recommended to by a coworker as I was traveling from out of state. This place was nothing short of spectacular, it almost became comical for how bad other restaurants truly are. The quality of the food is extremely good and the portion sizes are generous. If you're looking for a good, high-end place to eat, this is it. Pro tip: get the Crack Pie and a Bob Smith drink. You're taste buds will forever thank you.

Wow! What a treat!  Was at Foc'sle  on 10/1 with a friend.  I was impressed.  Sandwiches are amazing.  A wee pricey, but calling them sandwiches is also an understatement. The Suckling Pig Báhn Mi had a truly authentic, inspired Asian inspired taste, and the Grilled Rib Eye and Brie was nom nom!  It is around the corner from the Top, and I heartily recommend stopping by.
Delicious, nice atmosphere. Friendly.
The food was AMAZING! Clean, great service! Veteran owned and operated. Parking frustrating,  but worth it!

Foc’sle has fast become my absolute favorite restaurant in Gainesville. Every time I think I’ve tried everything on the menu Chef Glenn adds another stroke of genius. The banh mi is a crowd favorite but I have to say the Bistro Salad swept me off my feet. Not only is the food to die for but the staff and atmosphere are what keep me coming back every week. I knew I was in love when I came in the second time and Serena told me how glad she was to see me again, and then every time since. She is so fun and genuine and hospitable. The conversation is never dull at the bar as Phillip shakes and pours and goes into detail about his craft cocktails. He is a master of anticipating the needs of his bar guests. It’s always a treat when Chef Glenn comes out of the kitchen and chats about his dishes and inspiration. I have been recommending Foc’sle to everyone I know.
Amazing food and a wonderful staff.

Roasted beet and watermelon salad and roasted tomato salad were excellent and very fresh. Yakitori and grilled ribeye were great, well seasoned . My wife who loves duck, thought the burger was unique and exceeded her expectations. Lovely atmosphere and service. Looking forward to returning soon.
Holy Hecko is this place tasty. Every item is so packed with flavor. Get the Bánh mì it is so good.
While a bit pricey for a sandwich, the food is delicious and the money goes to Navy vets.

Newly opened and delicious!  Everything is fresh, well prepared, and tasty.  The service was good too. The Bahn mi, (spelling), and roasted beet & watermelon salad were my personal favorites of the six things we tried, but all were very good. It's great to see a new restaurant in town with such good food. The Roast Duck Burger, Gazpacho, Yakatori, Lamb Birria, and Ribeye/Brie sandwich were other very good selections. The chef knows what he is doing!
GREAT food.  Eclectic mix of some really good ingredients.  I'm going back for sure!

Oh man, this place was so good. They just opened and the food is some of the best I’ve ever had in Gainesville. Even had a few drinks and they were really unique and tasty. I will be a regular here for sure!
